textBeforeTable: MOVX operand1,operand2 Syntax: Move Data To/From External Memory (XRAM) Function: MOVX Operation: MOVX 8051 instruction :: Movx //--> google_ad_height = 90; google_ad_width = 160; google_ad_slot = "1243909493"; /* LLDIV160x90 */ google_ad_client = "pub-2749910568817823";
textAfterTable: Description: MOVX moves a byte to or from External Memory into or from the Accumulator. If operand1 is @DPTR, the Accumulator is moved to the 16-bit External Memory address indicated by DPTR. This instruction uses both P0 (port 0) and P2 (port 2) to output the 16-bit address and data. If operand2 is DPTR then the byte is moved from External Memory into the Accumulator. If operand1 is @R0 or @R1, the Accumulator is moved to the 8-bit External Memory address indicated by the specified Register. This instruction uses only P0 (port 0) to output the 8-bit address and data. P2 (port 2) is not affected. If operand2 is @R0 or @R1 then the byte is moved from External Memory into the Accumulator.
